16: While the tribe of Judah boasts the kingly lineage, specifically Israel's beloved kings David and Solomon, the tribe of Levi is the priestly tribe. These men are at the center of the worship of the Lord, performing the daily rituals and sacrifices required in the law. These are the Levite clans according to their patronage: Levi fathered Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

64: Because the Levites were a priestly tribe without their own land, the other tribes each gave them cities and pastures.[a]
